column1: ICYMI: My latest e-newsletter went out last night and recaps the last several weeks in Congress. Read it and subscribe to future editions here: https://t.co/iCRJipB1Ar https://t.co/FtnsNyZ2fI

THIS WEEK: After withholding "urgent" impeachment articles from the Senate for 28 days Speaker Pelosi FINALLY allowed a vote to move the process forward.   Meanwhile...new economic victories thanks to @POTUS: ✅ USMCA clears the Senate ✅ Phase 1 of China Trade Deal signed https://t.co/8vz9bRDpe5

While Democrats spend their time further politicizing impeachment @POTUS is doing the work of the American people today delivering another HISTORIC trade win for job creators workers and the economy. https://t.co/E5iydHrQwz

Four weeks later @SpeakerPelosi finally allowed a vote to actually send so-called urgent impeachment articles to the Senate. After trying to dictate terms of the trial it's clear @HouseDemocrats know they failed to prove their case against @POTUS.
I applaud @POTUS for negotiating and delivering yet another trade win for American job creators and workers! https://t.co/oYOrva45O1

WATCH: Earlier today I filmed a recap of the first week back in legislative session this year. Meaningful legislating in the Democrat-controlled House was lacking but partisan drama and political games were not in short supply. https://t.co/FCHvanZ1hH

During last night's Rules hearing on a war powers resolution coming to the floor today I reminded everyone: @POTUS taking out a terrorist responsible for killing hundreds of Americans - and who was plotting to kill more - is NOT the same thing as waging war on Iran. https://t.co/uHrX43ejU5

The war powers resolution by @HouseDemocrats says more about their opposition to @POTUS than exercising congressional authority. Article II of the Constitution clearly gives the president legal authority to use DEFENSIVE military force in response to imminent threats to the U.S. https://t.co/iBK7uKCL7G
The Rules Committee is meeting now to consider H. Con. Res. 83 related to war powers.    Text of my opening remarks: https://t.co/trnLakJCcW https://t.co/7nKKJbITip

.@POTUS has made it clear that terrorist actions against Americans will not go unanswered. Congress & the Administration MUST put politics aside & work together to deter Iran from future destabilizing actions.   My latest statement⬇️ https://t.co/cStqcSZiHS
While @POTUS was right to act with precision when he did the decision to take out terrorist leader General Soleimani is both serious and consequential.   My full statement  ⬇️ https://t.co/xxqPQnyTXk

As a new decade begins there are numerous signs that America is thriving. Wages continue to rise unemployment remains low jobs are being created & the economy is getting stronger. Certainly that’s worth celebrating as we ring in 2020! 🎉  MORE: https://t.co/wJ4NIY1P2O https://t.co/FefZFHrUrD
Thinking of my colleague and friend @RepJohnLewis whose decades of service to our country is beyond remarkable. Praying for his speedy recovery.
Wishing you and yours a joy-filled day. Merry Christmas! https://t.co/5B60VqP1B2
After running a totally partisan and closed impeachment process in the House @SpeakerPelosi now wants an open and bipartisan process in the Senate? That is the height of political hypocrisy! -TC

It's been a roller coaster of a week. Apart from the news dominating the partisan vote on articles of impeachment last night the House actually got a lot of bipartisan work done this week. More in my weekly chat ⬇️ https://t.co/EQUl6au8wB

While it is long overdue I am proud that the House finally advanced #USMCA an historic trade deal skillfully negotiated and secured by @POTUS that delivers real benefits to American job creators workers and consumers. https://t.co/K0eRLHC1JM

Democrats' rush to impeach @POTUS using a flawed & unfair process sets a precedent that runs the risk of legitimizing impeachment as an acceptable weapon that can now be used in partisan political warfare. That should concern EVERY single one of us. https://t.co/hDnqF8ktAS

This is no way to go about impeaching a president. I oppose proceeding any further. I oppose the rule. I oppose this limited rushed and unfair process. And I CERTAINLY OPPOSE impeaching @POTUS. https://t.co/rXNNLlFcud

Today's Rules hearing setting up floor debate for the impeachment articles was yet another telling signal that Congress is on an awfully dangerous and divisive course. This isn't good for the institution or the American people.   Watch my closing thoughts and reflections ⬇️ https://t.co/CeSBuUTXTj

Though we may be moving forward with an impeachment vote I certainly do not think @HouseDemocrats have proven their case or convinced the American people that the weeks of wasted time was worth it.   My full remarks from today's hearing ⬇️ https://t.co/AaU6dq1G2g
WATCH: It's been a mixed bag of a week in the House. Earlier today I reflected on the good the bad and the ugly of it all. https://t.co/f91DxtbYIO

The good news: Bipartisan solutions already exist to lower prescription drug prices and find #MoreCures!   The bad news: Today Democrats advanced a radical bill that would lead to #FewerCures instead.   MORE: https://t.co/4q147uWPbZ https://t.co/851l4XwMaQ

Proud to vote for the bipartisan #FY20NDAA conference report in the House today & I applaud the leadership of Oklahoma’s @JimInhofe who fiercely fought for the needs of our active duty service members military families retirees & civilian workers. https://t.co/DOATA6ducE
Do you know why it matters whether the government is funded by a continuing resolution or full-year appropriations?   Discussion in my column ⬇️ https://t.co/6ylkMPxHDs

After weeks of impeachment hearings Democrats have failed to prove their case or convince the American people that the wasted time was worth it. There are no grounds here to impeach @POTUS. https://t.co/sKxjEpidUG

Each year I have the privilege of nominating #OK04 students for appointment to one of the nation's fine military academies. For potential fall 2020 admission I am honored to recommend 20 remarkable student leaders. #FourthDistrictFriday  MORE ⬇️ https://t.co/T9jDAhY8kp

As impeachment continues to dominate the news and take up attention in Congress legislative days are RAPIDLY running out and several pressing items for the American people are still left undone. More in my weekly chat  ⬇️ https://t.co/pOb5oPXD1A

I am disappointed by Speaker Pelosi’s decision to move forward with articles of impeachment to remove President Trump from office. Based on what I have seen so far I do not think the House has grounds to do so. https://t.co/4D6YpfBsYj

I am greatly encouraged that the Lawton Ft. Sill Regional Airport now has the resources to move ahead with a terminal expansion project that has been years in the making. Read more: https://t.co/7NryzKevLt

During #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth it's important to remember the role tribes and their leaders have played in our collective history - like the legendary Chief Standing Bear. More in my recent column: https://t.co/7Kworf8RJl https://t.co/xtryPGZmXQ

Even when trials disagreements and differing points of view seek to divide us #Thanksgiving reminds all Americans to take a step back and pause in collective gratitude. More in my column: https://t.co/ExoEKO77fM https://t.co/vKgwS3zufd

NEW: Yesterday evening I sent out my latest e-newsletter to recap the last several weeks of work in #OK04 and in DC for legislative session. Read and subscribe for future updates here: https://t.co/hnV6tCv0Mv https://t.co/3LornDFird
On Public Health Thank You Day we rightly celebrate the vital contributions of #publichealth professionals who help build and sustain safer and healthier communities for all Americans. #PHTYD

I am deeply saddened to hear about the loss of two brave airmen at Vance AFB during a training accident today. My prayers are with the families friends and loved ones of those lost. https://t.co/YsXinFsI6b

Before heading home for Thanksgiving I was encouraged that Congress passed a short-term measure to keep the government open and funded. Though not ideal I am hopeful we can agree on appropriations for the full fiscal year in the weeks ahead. My takeaways from this week ⬇️ https://t.co/2S8PPjoRaW
Proud that #OK04's own @MAChristianUniv has been selected as a recipient of a @USDA grant that will widen access to STEM learning in rural Oklahoma. MORE: https://t.co/2nDmBuGN6V

While short-term measures are never ideal the CR passed today prevents a painful government shutdown and provides time for both chambers to negotiate and reach agreement on full-year appropriations for FY 2020. MORE: https://t.co/8BQZn9Wyzl https://t.co/lCuU69CT6g
ICYMI: Last night during a Rules hearing couldn't pass up the opportunity to brag on a GLORIOUS comeback for the Sooners this past weekend! #BoomerSooner cc: @OU_Football https://t.co/vYi9ZnT7ax

It's been another week dominated by the Democrats' impeachment circus in the House. The difference from prior weeks is the public hearings which have so far revealed more about how partisan and unfair the process is than anything else. My takeaways ⬇️ https://t.co/Xd9QD6w14N

The #USMCA is a bipartisan win that benefits the economy and America's workers farmers ranchers and businesses. It's time to pass #USMCAnow!   Learn more: https://t.co/SVI8MqvZwc https://t.co/TZ0AliBXww

On #VeteransDay we rightly pause to honor and remember the many men and women who selflessly answered the call of duty and wore one of the many great U.S. military uniforms. Thinking of my own relatives who served today: https://t.co/iRiZTmV3d4 https://t.co/LHUTgP523j

#OnThisDay 140 years ago Will Rogers was born! Today we remember the famous sense of humor and incredible legacy of Oklahoma's favorite son.   Learn about his prominently located statue in @uscapitol from @rollcall ➡️ https://t.co/hMdo6jXwxt https://t.co/YOr8AmbeXY

As I said during Meet the Press this morning House Democrats' pursuit of impeachment not only makes political polarization worse but it means less can get done for the American people.   Full interview here: https://t.co/4cD0FQWVog https://t.co/UULgu35c6i
TUNE IN: I’ll joining @MeetThePress in a few minutes to discuss this past week in the House. https://t.co/oxr1zQyWR5

Especially with something as consequential as impeachment it is a disservice to the American people for one side to dictate the terms of the process - as Democrats did this week. More in my weekly chat ⬇️ https://t.co/HvglPK7IgH

Today's impeachment process resolution fails to give the minority the same rights present during the Clinton impeachment & it fails to offer the same due process protections given to both Presidents Nixon & Clinton.   My full remarks from floor debate on H. Res. 660 ⬇️ https://t.co/dsKxaFRAYQ

Spent much of the afternoon & evening with @RulesReps debating @SpeakerPelosi's impeachment process resolution. Sadly the process laid out is far from fair open or transparent. That is a disservice to the American people. Watch my opening remarks: https://t.co/Ua406ekWcH

Tomorrow is Prescription Drug Take Back Day! At the link here find a collection site near you. Together we can help prevent drug abuse addiction and overdose. https://t.co/GZ9HqT3fko https://t.co/X32rFJXXgZ

During Domestic Violence Awareness Month we join in strong support of victims & survivors. It is also a timely reminder for Congress to renew expired resources for communities to combat & prevent domestic violence including in Indian Country. Read more: https://t.co/Xumh2c2AbR

The House has been back in session for 2 weeks. Unfortunately the unprecedented impeachment inquiry pursued by Democrats is taking up all the air in the room and distracting lawmakers from actually legislating for the American people. My latest thoughts on recent events: https://t.co/EeUU6lpIkN

Did you know that #OK04's own were selected as recipients of @NSF’s #PAEMST? That's the HIGHEST U.S. recognition for K-12 teachers in STEM fields or computer science. Many congrats to Jayci Harris & Julie Klingensmith! #FourthDistrictFriday https://t.co/e3Nt06sdGG

After 2 weeks of dedicated district time the House is back for 3 weeks of session. While I was in #OK04 I had some great visits with constituents & community leaders. Recap on that & more in my latest e-news: https://t.co/v182U24kXi https://t.co/ga23PsA1kp
Enjoyed being part of the discussion on this week's episode #Flashpoint on @kfor. ICYMI when it aired on Sunday watch online below: https://t.co/dbpgsyKeHT

I am concerned by the president’s decision to swiftly withdraw U.S. troops in Northeast Syria. This policy is a risky move that will not only undo significant gains but may well invite aggression by other bad actors & terrorists. Full statement ⬇️ https://t.co/qCtH3AlzmK
There was clearly one topic that dominated this week in Congress. In my weekly chat video I review the events that took place. Hope you'll take the time to listen. https://t.co/6usHn1RHC6

REMINDER: The October 4th application deadline is fast approaching for #OK04 HS seniors seeking a congressional nomination to one of the nation's service academies. Click below or call my Norman office at (405) 329-6500 for more details. https://t.co/iAAGl4Yh5s
Facts matter. And in my opinion the facts released to date don’t justify impeachment.

As promised & in the interest of transparency @POTUS released the transcript of his phone call with Ukrainian President Zelensky. After reading the transcript for myself I don’t think it warrants the grounds for impeachment that Democrats prematurely claimed ahead of release.

Speaker Pelosi & @HouseDemocrats are doing an enormous disservice to the country by recklessly pursuing a partisan impeachment inquiry that puts the priorities of their Caucus ahead of the needs of the American people. Full statement ⬇️ https://t.co/FlTQRo7qqA
Today is #MuseumDay! Oklahoma's museums are numerous and appropriately reflect and celebrate our state's rich history. Consider visiting one during your Saturday today! https://t.co/huLpd6if0w

Courtney Gains of #OK04 is an inspiring leader for African American women with disabilities and I'm honored to advocate on her behalf as a new member of the Congressional Task Force on Down Syndrome. WATCH her interview w/ @OKCFOX: https://t.co/x206Gf7Jau   #FourthDistrictFriday https://t.co/dqw8DTpn87
Thank you for the great honor! https://t.co/JTUHUX2QN0

This week has been a mixed bag. On a positive note the House responsibly passed a CR to keep the government open. Disappointingly by contrast House Democrats also pushed through a misguided bill that's better named the "Trial Lawyers Protection Act." More in my weekly chat! https://t.co/trMgYU9dtq

Thinking of my namesake & late uncle Tom today. As a POW in WWII he was held in prison camps & forced to walk the Bataan Death March. He kept a booklet (now in my DC office) listing the brave men he met so he'd never forget them. #POWMIARecognitionDay  https://t.co/wZZtqeh7Sw https://t.co/ErXeKcjHOe

September is National Preparedness Month which is an important reminder to have a plan for staying safe during an emergency including severe weather that's common in Oklahoma. @Readygov has some valuable resources to help you #beready. #PreparedNotScared https://t.co/P0EMYXGwfr

The continuing resolution passed today not only keeps the government open & vital operations funded but it also provides critical authorization for some important programs that millions of Americans rely on.   My full statement: https://t.co/TKO03gpiHs
Since this day in 1947 @usairforce has valiantly defended our nation through the control and exploitation of air and space. Happy 72nd birthday #AirForce! #OTD https://t.co/zdWgtmDoJN

On #ConstitutionDay we celebrate the most important document ever written for securing liberty from the ambition of tyrants. Today I encourage you to read this timeless document and reflect on the greatness America has achieved as a result. More: https://t.co/uPbOCy3O7T https://t.co/EvuS9CLAkP

Very saddened to hear of the passing of Cokie Roberts a brilliant journalist and even better human being. She will be missed greatly by her loving family many friends and an admiring and appreciative public.  https://t.co/u4pS4s7mI1 https://t.co/ppA2rnDhfl

ICYMI: The extended work period included a great deal of time in #OK04 hearing directly from constituents community leaders & #smallbiz owners at town halls & other meetings. I also had some valuable learning trips abroad. Read more in my latest e-news: https://t.co/OaqOviMtNx https://t.co/ji6SZkd9I1

As the House returned for legislative session this week after the extended work period I enjoyed welcoming several groups of Oklahomans in town - including the @okstatechamber. Recap in my weekly chat ⬇️ https://t.co/ZS9piJaYlS
Truly one of the most influential Oklahomans in our state’s history T. Boone Pickens leaves behind an incredible legacy that stretches far beyond the borders of Oklahoma. https://t.co/PaBEUh2jsH

Though our world was shaken & sense of security shattered 18 years ago today we quickly proved our resilience. We showed that in times of crisis Americans will always unite always endure always defend & always prevail. #NeverForget #Remembering911 https://t.co/5XSBQEkfsF https://t.co/6mVa4yXpSt

Did you know there's a way to further improve America's economy & create more jobs? But as long as House Democrats fail to act on #USMCA American entrepreneurs farmers & ranchers will miss out on the benefits. We need to advance #USMCAnow! More: https://t.co/H4ykANkoVI https://t.co/67Gd7Z5xda

REMINDER: Before Congress returns for legislative session next week I’m hosting one more town hall TODAY at noon. We’ll be meeting at the Moore Public Library. Hope to see you! https://t.co/gIZ58hFMSs

While I am disappointed @POTUS has been forced to direct the deferral of military construction projects in order to secure the border he is right to do so. I just visited the border & I agree that efforts to strengthen security must not be delayed. MORE: https://t.co/kaIkzAmrq7

Last night I returned from a trip to the U.S.-Mexico border with @SenCapito & @RoyBlunt. During our visit I was grateful to observe the situation & hear directly from those monitoring & managing the various humanitarian & security needs. Read more: https://t.co/oWLlaB88fw https://t.co/zgHsi0wKkJ
TOMORROW: I’m hosting a town hall meeting in Moore at noon. If you’re in the area hope you’ll join the discussion. We’ll be in the Community Room at the Moore Public Library!

#FourthDistrictFriday Spotlight: Many thanks to these @GradyCountySO deputies who selflessly volunteered as security on their own time at my Chickasha town hall last week. Grateful for their daily dedication to our communities! https://t.co/m4OJZpURKA
TODAY: I’m hosting a town hall meeting at the Red River Technology Center in Duncan at noon. If you’re in the area hope you’ll join the discussion. We’ll be in the Seminar Room!

ICYMI: Last week brought some significant news affirming the tremendous talent & potential that exists in our state’s medical & research communities. Congrats on the new grants @OMRF!  Read more: https://t.co/dK4jTc8vBA #ResearchMatters https://t.co/T0GTq2BQM1
TODAY: I’m hosting a town hall meeting in Pauls Valley at noon. If you’re in the area hope you’ll join the discussion. We’ll be at the Donald W. Reynolds Recreation Center!
TODAY at 5:30pm: I’m hosting a town hall meeting in Chickasha at the Canadian Valley Technology Center. If you’re in the area hope you’ll join the discussion. We’ll be in the Seminar Center!

My Norman office is a welcome change of scenery for a quick update about what I've been up to the last few weeks including a valuable learning trip abroad earlier this month and kicking off town hall meetings with #OK04 constituents this week. Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/vSavYsfk5R
TODAY at 5:30pm: I’m hosting a town hall meeting in Norman at the National Weather Center. If you’re in the area hope you’ll join the discussion. We’ll be in the auditorium!

This week the House wrapped up legislative activity for the next several weeks and I am proud to report that it ended on a high note with passage of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2019. Learn more in my weekly chat ⬇️ https://t.co/g2XhGHY6NV
Many thanks to Edward Emily and Amanda for lending their time and talent as interns in my DC office this summer and helping serve #OK04 constituents! #NationalInternDay https://t.co/WEg0lfiVUY
I remember it like it was yesterday - especially walking back to our house looking at the Moon and knowing that three American astronauts were there looking back at us. -TC 📷: @NASA

I remember watching the #Apollo11 mission 50 years ago with my father at our next door neighbor’s home. He had the only color TV on the block. My dad a career USAF guy was so deeply moved. https://t.co/bcx3ki4eP1

I remember watching the #Apollo11 mission 50 years ago with my father at our next door neighbor’s home. He had the only color TV on the block. My dad a career USAF guy was so deeply moved. https://t.co/bcx3ki4eP1

It's been an eventful week in Congress in terms of the legislation considered as well as some drama that took place on the House floor. Watch my weekly chat below for a quick recap and for my thoughts ⬇️ https://t.co/Qzchkxpghu

I will neither participate in nor support efforts that use the tools of the House as a one-sided weapon to punish the president while ignoring the reckless rhetoric of so many of his Democratic critics. My full statement on H. Res. 489 ⬇️ https://t.co/qzPcAEkkzl
Americans who have different opinions are not racists. They are just Americans who have different opinions. Let’s respect one another more disparage one another less and heal our land.
It is time to dial down the rhetoric on both sides and restore civility to the House floor and our national dialogue.
The result? Speaker Pelosi’s remarks of the floor were ruled out of order this afternoon and the House was plunged into chaos.
In Rules Committee last night I warned that if Democrats proceeded with their reckless resolution it would be like "throwing gasoline on the fire." They went ahead anyway.
I am deeply disappointed in the president’s comments directed toward fellow Americans and members of Congress. Use of such language is inappropriate and demeans the office of the presidency.

I am disappointed that Democrats turned the historically bipartisan NDAA into a partisan exercise. Until today I’ve never voted no on this annual bill because it’s always rightly affirmed support for our troops and the critical resources they need. https://t.co/OD3678ALhF
Look forward to being on the show in a few minutes. Tune in ⬇️ https://t.co/cexfLfaBFx

I've never voted against a National Defense Authorization Act and that's because it's always been rightly bipartisan. Unfortunately that's not the case with this year's House bill which is marked by partisanship and process failures. I will be voting no. My floor remarks ⬇️ https://t.co/kAnQ4p9PTk

On the #FourthofJuly we celebrate the courage conviction & boldness of those who came before us to secure American liberty. May we always remember the sacrifices made to preserve our precious freedoms for we truly live in the greatest nation on earth. https://t.co/he8VXEZEDj https://t.co/T5ucXAOSh6

ICYMI: My monthly e-news went out yesterday! Read it for an update on what's been happening in Congress and to learn more about my latest activities representing #OK04: https://t.co/xWa3yGCNPM https://t.co/41N1kKpBYH

Want to request a congressional commendation or presidential greeting for someone living in #OK04? Requests can be submitted on my website. If you have any questions please contact my DC office at (202) 225-6165. https://t.co/nHE3qQpIR8

Journalists have gone to great lengths & even put themselves in harm's way to keep Americans informed. One year since the @capgaznews tragedy I was proud to introduce a bipartisan bill authorizing a memorial to honor the legacy of fallen journalists. https://t.co/aL68G6mre4

#OK04's winner of the Congressional Art Contest Audrey Wehrer made the trip to DC this week! Over the next year her artwork "Seaside Oklahoma" will be displayed in the Cannon tunnel to the Capitol. Way to go Audrey! #FourthDistrictFriday https://t.co/FkE9sNIUBz https://t.co/CmX884rJf8

We NEED immediate aid for the humanitarian crisis at the southern border. The Senate already passed a strong bipartisan solution that we can get to @POTUS' desk TODAY if House Democrats will simply allow a vote on it. My remarks on the floor earlier ⬇️ https://t.co/iwzxrEXnpm

Started off yesterday with the one and only Captain America! 🇺🇸 Thanks to @ChrisEvans for inviting me to be part of a worthwhile project to improve understanding of politics the issues and the perspectives held on both sides. https://t.co/mKqQImtJwL

In divided government no problems are solved through partisan legislation. And in the critical days ahead Democrats MUST be willing to compromise with Republicans in order to manage - not exacerbate - the humanitarian crisis at our southern border. https://t.co/O3xJ1s8P9H
IN MY WEEKLY CHAT: Did you know that June is Alzheimer’s and Brain Awareness Month? Thinking very much of my late father who was a victim of this brutal disease. -TC #ENDALZ https://t.co/7YHysvzlHX

Did you know that #OK04's very own Jaylin Vinson was selected to the 2019 #NYO2 ensemble administered by @CarnegieHall? Congratulations to Jaylin on this incredible achievement! #FourthDistrictFriday https://t.co/JJqaUDSGRt
Many congrats to Joy Harjo who today made history as the first Native American AND Oklahoman appointed to U.S. Poet Laureate! https://t.co/wb7Ju337qT
We just started consideration of a funding package in Rules. There’s a lot of ground to cover in this 5-bill minibus so we expect it to be a long evening. Follow along ⬇️ https://t.co/NM33P7SOmZ

Especially on #FathersDay I'm remembering and missing my dad John Cole. He spent his career defending our nation in the Air Force and a lifetime protecting and advancing our family. Grateful for his impact on me. https://t.co/ciTxqASQGW

There IS a real humanitarian crisis at the southern border but Democrats have so far blocked 15 separate efforts to fulfill @POTUS' funding request to cover the immediate and urgent needs. https://t.co/U9RiBzhfWK

It's been an eventful week in Congress. In the midst of all the legislative activity I was disappointed that Democrats refused - for the 15TH TIME - to provide immediate humanitarian aid to deal with the crisis at our southern border. My weekly recap ⬇️ https://t.co/dYjMhozQIE

I have every confidence in those involved and tasked with the challenging job ahead but I also have no doubt that our leaders at Fort Sill as well as local officials and the Lawton community will be welcoming and supportive.

While using Fort Sill as a shelter for vulnerable unaccompanied children is only temporary it highlights the dire need for a permanent solution to manage the humanitarian crisis at the border. https://t.co/osMAm0gM9G

Managing the surge of migrants coming to the southern border - including vulnerable unaccompanied children - is overwhelming our resources. We NEED humanitarian aid and we need it TODAY. https://t.co/pCZexlGrHw

Passport issue? My staff can make an inquiry on your behalf and help you get answers. Start the process by visiting this page on my website or call my Norman office at (405) 329-6500. https://t.co/DQUufwjvUl

On this day 75 years ago Allied Forces stormed the beaches at Normandy to confront Nazi Germany. We still remember and honor the courage displayed on June 6 1944 - an operation that ultimately led to liberation of Europe. #DDay #OTD https://t.co/zBLUaavizo https://t.co/RarYmxgHwh
While it's been a relatively short legislative week there is still plenty to discuss. Watch my recap! https://t.co/hpxSjrOWfl
Cancer survivors display perseverance strength and courage. Today on National Cancer Survivors Day we honor those who have defied the odds and beat cancer! #NCSD2019
As May comes to a close check out my latest e-news for an update on my activities over the last month. Read and subscribe for future updates here: https://t.co/1DQZpNvfNW https://t.co/XEnyOnVtYX
.@RepFrankLucas I’m willing to take that bet! But let’s up the ante. How about we throw in a Field’s pecan pie? #BoomerSooner -TC https://t.co/7hrR5qk76l

I am proud to announce and congratulate the #OK04 students who received and accepted appointments to one of America's prestigious military service academies! Read more: https://t.co/BQAeV0B2dB #FourthDistrictFriday https://t.co/8iUemgu3yu
While we cannot always predict the severity of weather we can predict how we’ll respond to it by having a plan and the necessary supplies on hand. Do you have a plan? https://t.co/jqnOWKZNGW

On #MemorialDay we reflect on the patriotism and immense courage displayed time and again by our military. Today we pause in deep gratitude for the heroes who paid the ultimate price offering their last full measure of devotion in defense of freedom. https://t.co/9fTS146Gqi

WATCH: Filmed a quick recap of the week in my office after votes today. This week it was especially busy in the House Appropriations Committee where we marked up four bills. @HouseAppropsGOP https://t.co/jFuyy9RROF
Our forebearers trusted free people free speech and free markets – all of which continue to undergird the “American dream." More in my column: https://t.co/i7J3QvfdTp
Oklahoma's favorite son Will Rogers still enjoys celebrity status. Had fun filming in the "Will Rogers Corridor" while talking about the legendary man himself! https://t.co/uOVBZVWprJ

#OTD 100 years ago the House advanced the #19thAmendment to guarantee women the right to vote! This historic action paved the way for women to forever and rightly have an equal voice by voting. #WomensVote100 https://t.co/Lerh81R6CN

Significant parts of our state and #OK04 are on high alert for severe weather. As @NWS and local meteorologists inform us throughout the day exercise caution and heed any warnings immediately. Be careful and stay safe! Also follow: @NWSSPC https://t.co/sGvw8PJKCs
The men and women in our military are truly some of the most courageous & selfless among us. On #ArmedForcesDay we recognize the sacrifices they make on our behalf. https://t.co/kkpwHJD27v
WATCH: In between votes this week I sat down in my office to film a quick update about what's been happening in Congress. https://t.co/NXCV6EA1Ur
